intro: Hieracium subgracilipes, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender, hairy stems and basal leaves that are linear to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow and appear in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium subgracilipes is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
